description: The Pulumi Command Provider enables you to execute commands and scripts either locally or remotely as part of the Pulumi resource model.

command:local:run.description:
A local command to be executed.
This command will always be run on any preview or deployment. Use `local.Command` to avoid duplicating executions.

archivePaths.description:
A list of path globs to return as a single archive asset after the command completes.

When specifying glob patterns the following rules apply:
- We only include files not directories for assets and archives.
- Path separators are `/` on all platforms - including Windows.
- Patterns starting with `!` are 'exclude' rules.
- Rules are evaluated in order, so exclude rules should be after inclusion rules.
- `*` matches anything except `/`
- `**` matches anything, _including_ `/`
- All returned paths are relative to the working directory (without leading `./`) e.g. `file.text` or `subfolder/file.txt`.
- For full details of the globbing syntax, see [github.com/gobwas/glob](https://github.com/gobwas/glob)

#### Example

Given the rules:
```yaml
- "assets/**"
- "src/**.js"
- "!**secret.*"
```

When evaluating against this folder:

```yaml
- assets/
  - logos/
    - logo.svg
- src/
  - index.js
  - secret.js
```

The following paths will be returned:

```yaml
- assets/logos/logo.svg
- src/index.js
```

assetPaths.description:
A list of path globs to read after the command completes.

When specifying glob patterns the following rules apply:
- We only include files not directories for assets and archives.
- Path separators are `/` on all platforms - including Windows.

- `*` matches anything except `/`
- `**` matches anything, _including_ `/`
- All returned paths are relative to the working directory (without leading `./`) e.g. `file.text` or `subfolder/file.txt`.
- For full details of the globbing syntax, see [github.com/gobwas/glob](https://github.com/gobwas/glob)

#### Example

Given the rules:

- "src/**.js"

```yaml

  - logos/
    - logo.svg
- src/
  - index.js
  - secret.js
```

```yaml
- assets/logos/logo.svg
- src/index.js
```

dir.description:
The directory from which to run the command from. If `dir` does not exist, then
`Command` will fail.

environment.description: Additional environment variables available to the command's process.

interpreter.description:
The program and arguments to run the command.
On Linux and macOS, defaults to: `["/bin/sh", "-c"]`. On Windows, defaults to: `["cmd", "/C"]`

stdin.description: Pass a string to the command's process as standard in

archive.description: An archive asset containing files found after running the command.

A map of assets found after running the command.
The key is the relative path from the command dir

name: command

command:local:Command.description:
A local command to be executed.
This command can be inserted into the life cycles of other resources using the
`dependsOn` or `parent` resource options. A command is considered to have
failed when it finished with a non-zero exit code. This will fail the CRUD step
of the `Command` resource.

create.description: The command to run on create.

delete.description:
The command to run on delete. The environment variables PULUMI_COMMAND_STDOUT
and PULUMI_COMMAND_STDERR are set to the stdout and stderr properties of the
Command resource from previous create or update steps.

dir.description:
The directory from which to run the command from. If `dir` does not exist, then
`Command` will fail.

environment.description: Additional environment variables available to the command's process.

interpreter.description:
The program and arguments to run the command.
On Linux and macOS, defaults to: `["/bin/sh", "-c"]`. On Windows, defaults to: `["cmd", "/C"]`

stdin.description: Pass a string to the command's process as standard in

triggers.description: Trigger replacements on changes to this input.

update.description:
The command to run on update, if empty, create will 
run again. The environment variables PULUMI_COMMAND_STDOUT and PULUMI_COMMAND_STDERR 
are set to the stdout and stderr properties of the Command resource from previous 
create or update steps.

archive.description: An archive asset containing files found after running the command.

command:remote:Command.description:
A command to run on a remote host.
The connection is established via ssh.

connection.description: The parameters with which to connect to the remote host.

create.description: The command to run on create.

delete.description:
The command to run on delete. The environment variables PULUMI_COMMAND_STDOUT
and PULUMI_COMMAND_STDERR are set to the stdout and stderr properties of the
Command resource from previous create or update steps.

command:remote:CopyFile.description: Copy a local file to a remote host.

connection.description: The parameters with which to connect to the remote host.

localPath.description: The path of the file to be copied.

remotePath.description: The destination path in the remote host.

triggers.description: Trigger replacements on changes to this input.

connection.description: The parameters with which to connect to the remote host.

localPath.description: The path of the file to be copied.

remotePath.description: The destination path in the remote host.

triggers.description: Trigger replacements on changes to this input.

command:remote:Connection.description: Instructions for how to connect to a remote endpoint.

agentSocketPath.description: SSH Agent socket path. Default to environment variable SSH_AUTH_SOCK if present.

dialErrorLimit.description: Max allowed errors on trying to dial the remote host. -1 set count to unlimited. Default value is 10

dialTimeout.description: Userland remote connection timeout (in seconds, at each attempt). Default to 0 (no timeout). Does not override OS timeout.

host.description: The address of the resource to connect to.

password.description: The password we should use for the connection.

privateKey.description: The contents of an SSH key to use for the connection. This takes preference over the password if provided.

privateKeyPassword.description: The password to use in case the private key is encrypted.

user.description: The user that we should use for the connection.
